WRITING.TITLE: b'mom, how do i grow up?'
WRITING.TEXT: b'about a month ago i moved into my first apartment with one of my best friends, and everyone around me is having so much fun with this new freedom except me. i know that nothing will ever be like it was and i\xe2\x80\x99m mourning that every minute. i\xe2\x80\x99m mourning part of my youth, the simplicity and familiarly of my hometown and old house, no matter how boring of a small town it was. i\xe2\x80\x99m grieving absolutely everything i had that will never be the same, and i just wish i could have it all back for a few more minutes. even if i visit home, my room will be mostly empty and it will feel off. nothing will ever be the same and i miss it and i miss my dog and funnily enough i miss highschool despite how absolutely miserable i was while there because at least then i knew what i was doing. i feel completely and utterly lost and overwhelmed and i would do absolutely anything to be 16 again. mentally, i still am, and i feel like i didn\xe2\x80\x99t do enough while being a teenager and now that\xe2\x80\x99s gone and i can never get that back. now, i sit in my unfamiliar and uncomfortable room 400km away as i cry harder than i have in ages, wishing for something i can never possibly have'

WRITING.TITLE: b'mom, my sister abused me. no one takes it seriously'
WRITING.TEXT: b'we have an alright relationship now, but until she was around 13, my younger sister would hit me and hurt me all the time. people would always brush it off as her being younger and just throwing tantrums, or just sibling fights, but it was worse than that. i once went into her room to borrow something and left with a bleeding hand. she has given me many bruises over that time period, and it left me flinching whenever someone raised their voice at me. she once hit me so hard in my throat i couldn\xe2\x80\x99t breathe for a little. every negative emotion she took out with violence against me. i was scared of her. my actual mom always told me to hit her back but i never did. she would also tell me that i made her want to kill herself at times. this ended around 4 years ago and she\xe2\x80\x99s not like this anymore, she\xe2\x80\x99s just a bit verbally cruel, but i\xe2\x80\x99ve mentioned this to many people and no one has shown concern because it was just my little sister. abusers can be anyone.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'you\xe2\x80\x99re not too young, i\xe2\x80\x99m 18 and i have it. the good news is since we are young, it\xe2\x80\x99s a lot more likely that ours isn\xe2\x80\x99t caused by anything serious. mine used to be constant and accompanied by unpleasant sensations, but now it just comes and goes and i feel fine most of the time. i\xe2\x80\x99m also an avid music lover, so i understand your stress! but if your case is anything like mine, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be alright in time. it\xe2\x80\x99s still worth getting checked out though!'

WRITING.TEXT: b'in a world so romance centered, strong wants for a platonic friendship can easily be mistaken as a crush. ive had "crushes" before, but i never wanted to do anything romantic with them. later down the line, i realized i just really wanted to be that persons friend, and i\'ve been conditioned to think that i was having a crush.'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'mine is complicated. i first realized i was aro when i was 11. then i thought i might be a lesbian because i really liked my best friend. almost to an obsessive level. then i thought i was aro again when i was 12 and 13. then i went back to thinking i was a lesbian becasue the same thing happened with a new best friend. now i am 17, and i know im aro, and i learned that i also have ADHD, and i hyperfixated on my best friend, which i confused as having a crush on that person.  very unhealthy, im aware of that now. but it was definitely a confusing ride!'

WRITING.TITLE: b'personal mini-essay on my experience being aro (excuse the ending, im planning on putting it on my personal instagram as a coming out haha)'
WRITING.TEXT:
b"In a world so romance-centered, it can be incredibly difficult to even realize that you are aromantic. The narrative of \xe2\x80\x9cfinding the one\xe2\x80\x9d and marriage/a dating life being equated to success can make someone feel like they *need* to find a partner. The fact that there is little to no aromantic representation in media, and the fact that this lgbtq+ identity is hardly ever talked about in lgbtq+ discussions can make you unaware that this identity even exists. Once you realize that you are aromantic, it can be incredibly frustrating and isolating to live in a world so incredibly focused on something that is not even the slightest part of your life. It\xe2\x80\x99s in every song, every movie has it in some sort of focal plot, it\xe2\x80\x99s a huge focus in everyone else's life except yours. It can make someone feel broken, or like they need to be \xe2\x80\x9cfixed.\xe2\x80\x9d Then, once someone discovers that you\xe2\x80\x99re aromantic, you\xe2\x80\x99re met with \xe2\x80\x9care you sure you just haven\xe2\x80\x99t found the right person yet?\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cyou must be so lonely!\xe2\x80\x9d I promise you, I am incredibly happy on my own, and I have found the right person. I am the right person for me. I do not need to be fixed. 

Finding out that I was aromantic took a while. I identified as a lesbian for the longest time because I thought that if I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t attracted to men, I must be attracted to women, right? I had had all these \xe2\x80\x9ccrushes\xe2\x80\x9d on people, however they mysteriously went away as soon as we became closer friends. Turns out, you don\xe2\x80\x99t have to be attracted to anyone, and those crushes I had were actually just me really wanting to be this person's friend. Looking back at my constant disinterest in dating, this should\xe2\x80\x99ve been more evident to me. Ever since I was 10, I just couldn\xe2\x80\x99t really wrap my head around the desire for life-long partnership. It sounded exhausting! There was even a point where I called myself a \xe2\x80\x9cpassive lesbian\xe2\x80\x9d because I had no desire to have a romantic partner, but I still thought girls were pretty. News flash! You can still think people look good without being attracted to them. 

I\xe2\x80\x99m writing this after a long afternoon of me getting incredibly more and more frustrated with the complete lack of understanding of aromanticism, so I apologize for how completely unorganized this is. My thoughts are not organized. I think that aromanticism is one of the most forgotten about and misunderstood identities out there, so if you have any questions, I am completely open to any of them. With such little information out there, it can be hard to understand. And, if you think you may be aromantic, you are not broken, you do not need to be fixed :)"

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'i know exactly how that feels. i feel the exact same way whenever my friends start dating someone. i HATE the idea that your romantic partner needs to be your #1 person in life. sometimes it feels like you immediately get bumped down a spot, in a sense :///'

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b"hey dude. if she already has a boyfriend, my suggestion is to back off. she's clearly not interested. maybe if she ends up single, you can shoot your shot then! but respect her, and if she says no, she means that"

WRITING.TITLE: b' '
WRITING.TEXT: b'im in a very similar situation. seeing this post let me know im not alone. what i try to do is check up on them frequently, encourage them to talk to me, and i try to do nice things to brighten their day :) its not a lot, but i also feel very lost in how to proceed. the best thing you can do is listen and show you care'
